title: Ubisoft moving "some of our biggest productions" into 2026 and 2027 after positive impact of Assassin's Creed Shadows delay
description: Ubisoft says it has postponed several of its "biggest productions" currently in development in order to grant them more time in the oven, after previously delaying Assassin's Creed Shadows in order to provide further polish. Read more

title: Amazon Is Selling The Retired Lego NES For $60 Above MSRP
description: Lego NES Set (2,646 pieces) $330 | Previously $270 | Retired Product See at Amazon See at Target See at Walmart See at Best Buy See at Lego Store The Lego Nintendo Entertainment System was officially retired near the end of 2024, though the 2,646-piece set had remained available to buy at multiple retailers up until the last few weeks. As of May 14, the only major retailer with stock is Amazon, and at first glance, it'd be easy to mistake it for a reseller listing. That's because the NES has become one of the rare Lego sets Amazon is selling for above MSRP.Amazon has increased the price of the Lego NES from $270 to $330. The current price is actually a "deal" compared to the $355 price Amazon had last week. If Amazon doesn't run out of units first, it's possible the price will return to $270. Over the past few months, the retailer has temporarily raised the price to as high as $360, but none of those spikes held for this long. It's worth noting that Target's sold-out listing also shows $330, so it's possible Amazon was price-matching a competitor.As shown above, the Lego NES is sold and shipped by Amazon.Though rare, this isn't the first instance of Amazon going above MSRP after a Lego set has been retired. We previously saw this with the Horizon Forbidden West Tallneck, which increased from $90 to $105 last year before selling out for good (it's ~$150 from resellers). Just like with the NES, Amazon was the only major retailer with the Tallneck in stock.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fanatical's New $8 Mystery Bundle Gives You A Chance To Pull Doom: The Dark Ages, Clair Obscur, Oblivion Remastered, And
description: We're in the final few days of Fanatical's Bundlefest Spring 2025 event, but there are still some great new bundles on the way. Today's new bundle deal is the VIP Mystery Bundle - Ultimate Edition, which includes at least five acclaimed Steam games for just $8. The previous bundles launched so far include the Spring Superstars Collection May 2025 edition, Pedal to the Metal Supercharged Bundle, the Build Your Own Bento Bundle, the Slitherine Strategy Bundle, and the Killer Bundle Spring 2025 Edition. You'll find full details on all the Bundlefest Spring 2025 bundles below. The event runs until Friday, May 16, and there are still two more new bundles left before the event closes out, so be sure to check back tomorrow to see the next deal.Fanatical's Bundlefest Spring 2025 at a glanceWednesday, May 7: Killer Bundle (Bundlefest Spring 2025)Thursday, May 8: Slitherine Strategy BundleFriday, May 9: Build Your Own Bento Bundle (Spring 2025)Monday, May 12: Build Your Own Pedal to the Metal Bundle - SuperchargedTuesday, May 13: Build your own Spring Superstars Collection (May 2025)Wednesday, May 14: VIP Mystery Bundle - Ultimate EditionThursday, May 15: TBAFriday, May 16: TBA See all bundle deals at Fanatical It's worth noting that while Bundlefest Spring 2025 only lasts through Friday, May 16, the new bundles launched during the event will be available for several more weeks after. We've made sure to list when each bundle deal expires below.Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Hideo Kojima proposes a game where the protagonist forgets abilities if players take too long a break
description: Hideo Kojima is his own Peter Molydeux, in that he's forever out there pitching Kojima-like ideas for games he might make. Hideo Jokima? On a recent episode of his Japanese radio show, KOJI10, the designer of Metal Gear Solid and Death Stranding pitched a few ideas he had for games based around time. The best of the bunch: a game in which your character gradually forgets information if players take too long a break from playing. Read more
author: Graham Smith

title: Pathologic 3 devs defend choice to cut the plague town's open world to bits
description: Surreal first-person medical sim Pathologic 3 will be different from its plague-ridden predecessor in a lot of ways. In Pathologic 2 you played a roaming surgeon rooting around in bins for sustenance, and this time you play as the Bachelor, a well-fed doctor who diagnoses patients by inspecting their bodies and investigating their homes for signs of disease. But one of the biggest changes regards the open world. You won't freely explore the remote steppe town this time, but instead dander through isolated pockets, with lots of loading screens, map plotting, and fast travel. That's made a few fans grumpy, but developers Ice-Pick Lodge are sticking to their plans, as they've stated in a development update. Read more
author: Brendan Caldwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 878
description: So‚Ä¶what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn‚Äôt, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It‚Äôs just a list of more or less random questions I‚Äôve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What made you smile today? It‚Äôs early in the day (I just woke up 30 minutes ago), but so far petting Marnie and Rosie, and re-reading the homemade Mother‚Äôs Day card Connor made are two things that made me smile. 2. What‚Äôs the first thing you do when you get home and walk through the door? Hmmm, well, I want to say that I usually take off my shoes first thing because, hello, I need foot freedom (shoes are so oppressive), but I think what I technically do is lock the door behind me. 3. What‚Äôs your favorite cereal? Does oatmeal count? If it doesn‚Äôt then, it‚Äôs Kellogg‚Äôs Special K with the dried red strawberries. I don‚Äôt really eat it for breakfast, though. It‚Äôs more of a[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 878 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 860
description: It‚Äôs almost dusk here at Casa de MBB, and we‚Äôre getting cleaned up and ready for bed, but I still wanted to wish you a Happy Mother‚Äôs Day. There‚Äôs so much to say about Mother‚Äôs Day, isn‚Äôt there? It can be an emotional day in many ways for many reasons, different for everyone. People have such different relationships with their parents and their children and all of the creatures they care for, and life is fleeting. We all lose our care givers and loved ones someday, and days like today mean different things to all of us at different times in our lives. I pray and hope your day was good to you. Every Mother‚Äôs Day, just like every other day, I also think about Tabs. Oh! ‚Äî sometimes when I see an old picture like this one below, I tear up, especially on Mother‚Äôs Day. I sure miss my special boy! Rosie As you may or may not know, Rosie the Magnificent has her own connection to Mother‚Äôs Day because she is‚Ä¶ A mother![Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 860 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
